title: Kyrgyzstan - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 5 February 2021, about 250 residents of Batken region protested outside the regional state administration in Batken township, demanding the country's newly-appointed Prime-Minister retract and clarify his previous statement regarding part of the bordering Tort-Kul water reservoir that was transferred to Tajikistan. [size=about 250]

Around 5 February 2021, car drivers gathered at the city police towing park in Jalal-Abad city demanding to stop police discrimination of car owners based on social status, which protesters complained was taking a toll on their income. Protesters alleged police were engaged in targeting lower-class residents with automobiles resulting in parking tickets and towing for illegal parking. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, small retail business owners protested outside the Kyrgyz government's administration in Bishkek city against city restrictions placed on their shops, demanding the authorities allow them to operate and improve infrastructure at the Osh bazaar, where their businesses were located. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, about 100 residents of Ak-Suu village in Aksy district of Jalal-Abad region protested outside the local council building demanding the resignation of the head of the village administration following complaints of lack of oversight at the nearby mining projects, which protesters blamed for environmental concerns and safety issues in the area. [size=about 100]

On 4 February 2021, small business owners protested at the central bazaar in Jalal-Abad city against relocation of the market to another location demanding the city administration reject the plan and the city Mayor resign. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, supporters of former president Almazbek Atambayev protested outside the office of the country's state security service in Bishkek city, demanding his release from police custody and place him under house arrest instead. Protesters called for the chief of the security service to meet protesters and address their demands. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, about 20 protesters gathered outside the Mayor's office in Bishkek city demanding the city administration lift coronavirus restrictions on public schools and daycare facilities. [size=about 20]

On 3 February 2021, freelance cab drivers demonstrated near the main train station in Bishkek city against a Russian ride-hailing app demanding its removal in the country due to high service fees and unfriendly policy toward taxi operators. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, activists gathered outside the White House in Bishkek city demanding the country's president reject the candidate for Prime Minister proposed by lawmakers and choose a more competent person to lead the Cabinet. [size=no report]
On 3 February 2021, about 30 supporters of former president Almazbek Atambayev protested outside the Pervomayski district court in Bishkek city demanding his release from detention. [size=about 30]

On 2 February 2021, about 200 residents of the Jerge-Tal village protested on Turdakun Usubaliyev square in Naryn city, demanding the release of a fellow activist from police custody who was detained a day earlier after raising a pasture land dispute issues in public. Protesters also called for the authorities to resolve the local dispute involving pastures in the district. [size=about 200]

On 2 February 2021, activists gathered in the town of Suusamyr in Jaiyl district of Chui region to protest the sale of alcohol in the vicinity calling for the local community to join an anti-alcohol consumption campaign and ban alcohol beverages in the area. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, about 3 female activists protested outside the White House in Bishkek city against a proposed candidate for Prime-Minister demanding the country's president choose a more competent person to run the Cabinet. Protesters called for Interim PM to remain in office. [size=about 3]

On 2 February 2021, 20-30 small retail business owners protested outside the city administration in Jalal-Abad city against the planned relocation of the central bazaar to another area demanding the market remain at the same location. [size=20-30]

On 1 February 2021, small shop owners protested outside the city administration in Jalal-Abad city against the relocation of the central bazaar to another area demanding the market remain at the same location. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, residents of the Japalak neighborhood in Osh city protested against a nearby metal manufacturing facility demanding the city authorities shut it down due to environmental pollution and public health concerns in the area. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, about 120 small retail shop owners protested outside the Kyrgyz government's administration in Bishkek city demanding the central authorities intervene in their property dispute with the state agency and stop the eviction of their businesses out of Karavan shopping center the country's capital. [size=about 120]

On 1 February 2021, residents of Chon-Talaa village in Batken district protested at the regional state administration's office in Batken township, demanding the authorities build a new school for their children in the village after the old facility was destroyed by fire. [size=no report]
On 31 January 2021, about 20 activists protested on Ala Too square in Bishkek city against corruption demanding the country's government maintain rule of law. [size=about 20]

On 30 January 2021, residents of the apartment buildings on Usenbayeva street in Bishkek city protested outside their homes against illegal brothels in their buildings, demanding the city authorities and police shut down criminal activity and eliminate prostitution in the neighborhood due to safety concerns for the local community. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, a police officer physically assaulted a civilian at the scene of a traffic stop in the business district of Bishkek city after an initial argument between the two regarding video recording of police officers on the victim's smartphone.

On 28 January 2021, about 10 supporters of the former chief of the State Security Service, who was arrested days earlier, were detained by police near Toktogul Satylganov theater in Bishkek city for staging a protest in support of the politician. [size=about 10]

On 27 January 2021, residents of a neighbourhood protested on the premises of the Ular market in Bishkek city against the planned construction of the residential housing project on location demanding the city authorities cancel the project and build a park instead due to deteriorating air pollution in the city. [size=no report]
On 27 January 2021, about 40 activists demonstrated outside the White House in Bishkek city against incumbent members of parliament demanding their resignation. [size=about 40]

On 27 January 2021, residents of Kaindy township in Panfilov district of Chui region gathered outside the local stadium in support of a Mayor after a recent negative public campaign against town official on social media. Protesters argued life has improved in town under incumbent Mayor's leadership. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, residents of the Teshik-Tash neighbourhood in Osh city demonstrated outside the city administration demanding Mayor's office settle a longstanding land dispute between protesters and municipality. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, residents of the bordering with Uzbekistan's Sokh district Charbak village in Batken district of Batken region gathered near their homes demanding the Kyrgyz authorities provide water supply to their village or else buy their properties which would let protesters relocate to a more suitable area. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, residents of the Kara-Bak village in Batken district of Batken region gathered near their homes demanding the local authorities fix the power supply issues in the area which were becoming a safety concern, protesters complained. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, about 100 workers of the Ministry of Transport protested outside the ministry in Bishkek city demanding owed wages and timely pay which officials promised to resolve in a short period of time. [size=about 100]

On 25 January 2021, several residents of Bishkek city protested outside the city administration against bus ride fee increase demanding the authorities also raise wages and pensions if Mayor's office allows bus fare to go up. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, relatives of deceased victims, that died of coronavirus, protested outside the Ministry of Health in Bishkek city accusing top health officials of corruption and demanding lustration in the Ministry. [size=no report]

On 24 January 2021, about 30 activists protested on Ala-Too main square in Bishkek city against corruption in the country demanding the government operate within legal framework and Constitution. Protesters also expressed solidarity with anti-government demonstrations in Russia. [size=about 30]

On 23 January 2021, activists gathered at the Jerooy gold mine in Talas region demanding the company rebuild its unsafe tailings pond out of concerns for a possible spill of toxic chemicals into the local water sources. [size=no report]

On 21 January 2021, about 50 residents of Kyzyl-Alma village outside the town of Tash-Komur in Jalal-Abad region protested against nearby coal mining project Shyn-Sai demanding the local authorities close it down due to environmental concerns in the area. [size=about 50]

On 21 January 2021, teachers of a Musical college in Osh city protested on the premises against a self-appointed director demanding from the Ministry of Culture to remove her from the facility due to insufficient qualification for a job, protesters complained. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, bus drivers protested in Jalal-Abad city against alleged corruption in the regional department of transportation accusing local officials of extorting bribes from drivers for transportation service contracts. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, residents of the Kalacha village protested near Uch-Korgon township of Kadamjai district in Batken region against alleged corruption involving local officials after illegal land transactions, demanding the authorities investigate and redistribute plots among villagers. [size=no report]

On 17 January 2021, about 70 medics of the local hospital, family and dental clinics protested at the hospital in Tokmok city against integration of all three facilities into one medical center demanding a meeting with the country's Health official to address their concerns. [size=about 70]

On 15 January 2021, teachers of the local music school in Osh city protested on the premises against the newly-posted director, demanding the country's Ministry of Culture appoint a more qualified person to lead and manage the school. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2021, 7-8 persons with disabilities protested outside the Naryn regional state administration's office in Naryn city demanding the authorities grant property rights for a municipal residential building to protesters. One of the demonstrators attempted to commit an act of self-immolation but was prevented from doing so by policemen on the scene. [size=7-8]

Around 14 January 2021, residents of Ptitsefabrika neighbourhood in Jalal-Abad city protested near their homes against foreigners that were allegedly giving out candy and religious memorabilia to the local children. Protesters called the police while attempting to communicate with foreign citizens. [size=no report]
On 14 January 2021, about 30 supporters of former president Almazbek Atambayev protested at the Pervomaisky district court in Bishkek city demanding his release from prison. [size=about 30]

On 14 January 2021, relatives of an imprisoned citizen of Afghanistan protested outside the city court in Bishkek city demanding his release from prison, which protesters argued was based on fabricated criminal charges for alleged provocative postings on social media. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, residents of Osh city protested outside the Russian state-owned company Gazprom's local branch office against a lack of natural gas supply demanding the replacement of the company's local official due to poor performance with supply. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2021, about 50 activists and politicians marched through Erkindik boulevard in Bishkek city holding banners in protest of the referendum on the Constitutional reform, which was taking place on the same day as well. [size=about 50]

On 8 January 2021, about 100 protesters demonstrated near Ala-Too main square in Bishkek city to support the parliamentarian form of the republic in the country ahead of the referendum on the Constitutional reform. [size=about 100]

On 7 January 2021, residents of Ak-Talaa district in Naryn region protested at the local administration in the town of Baetov, demanding the authorities investigate the Turuk Mining company's illegal operation at the nearby coal project. Protesters accused the miner of tax evasion. [size=no report]

On 5 January 2021, small retail business owners protested at the local bazaar in the town of Batken of Batken region against the upcoming renovation of their market, demanding the bazaar management be removed from office. [size=no report]
KFTU: Kyrgyzstan Federation of Trade Unions; Labour Group (Kyrgyzstan)
On 4 January 2021, a group of people attacked the head of the Trade Union and his assistants at the main office in Bishkek city, trying to force the president of the Union to resign from office.

On 4 January 2021, residents of Ak-Dobo village in Aksy district of Jalal-Abad region gathered near their homes demanding the local authorities release three of their fellow villagers from police custody or else protesters will be blocking nearby motor road if their demands aren't met. [size=no report]

On 3 January 2021, dozens of activists protested on Ala-Too main square in Bishkek city against the upcoming referendum on the Constitutional reform demanding the Interim government abide by the country's laws and preserve freedom of speech in the nation. [size=dozens]

On 2 January 2021, hundreds of supporters of three Aksy district residents, who were detained in October 2020, protested outside the State Security Service office in Jalal-Abad city demanding their release from detention. Protesters called the authorities to arrange house arrest for detained fellows. [size=hundreds]

On 30 December 2020, about 3 persons with disabilities protested at the Mayor's Office in the town of Naryn demanding the local administration transfer the state-subsidized housing property ownership to protesters' households or else they will continue protesting at the townhall indefinitely. [size=about 3]

On 29 December 2020, about 30 teachers and medical workers demonstrated outside the Kyrgyz government's administration in Bishkek city urging the country's authorities to lower interest rate on the state-backed mortgages for the state workers and employees. [size=about 30]
On 29 December 2020, dozens of mortgage holders gathered outside the Mayor's Office in Osh city calling for the city council to lower interest rate on the municipal housing loans. [size=dozens]

On 28 December 2020, employees of the Environmental Protection and Forestry agency demonstrated outside their office in Bishkek city demanding the Kyrgyz government remove a newly appointed director from office due to a labour conflict between employees and the new head of the agency. [size=no report]

On 28 December 2020, about 24 former employees of a nursing home demonstrated outside the Kyrgyz government's administration in Bishkek city against their former director whom protesters accused of misconduct, demanding the authorities probe nursing home management. [size=about 24]

On 28 December 2020, residents of Khaidarkan township in Batken region gathered outside a local bank to protest against its closure, demanding the bank's management keep it operating for the town population. [size=no report]

On 27 December 2020, activists and politicians protested on main Ala-Too square in Bishkek city against the referendum on Constitutional reform scheduled on 10 January 2021. Protesters announced their next demonstration will be organized on 3 January 2021. [size=no report]

On 25 December 2020, residents of Murake village protested outside the Moscovsky district administration's office in Belovodskoe township of Chui region, demanding the local authorities provide access to drinking water in their village. [size=no report]

On 25 December 2020, cancer patients protested at the Ministry of Health in Bishkek city, demanding the country's government allocate additional funds to treat people with oncological diseases. [size=no report]

On 24 December 2020, the Jusup Balasagyn National State University teachers protested at the main campus in Bishkek city demanding bonus pay, which protesters complained they are entitled to every end of the year. Teachers complained the dean's office failed to provide proper compensation for their work. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, supporters of former president Almazbek Atambayev protested outside the Pervomayski district court in Bishkek city demanding his release from pre-trial detention. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, residents of the Kara-Jygach village in Alamudun district of Chui region protested near their homes against the disposal of 16,000 dead chickens by the local chicken farm in the area, demanding the disease control authorities investigate the farm for possible infection source. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, about 15 teachers and medics protested outside the Kyrgyz government's administration in Bishkek city demanding the state mortgage agency lower interest rate on their housing loans due to inability to afford monthly payments. Protesters complained they could barely cover full payments. [size=about 15]
On 23 December 2020, the Ministry of Transport employees demonstrated at the Ministry in Bishkek city demanding back pay for several months of work. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, about 20 villagers from Emgeckchil township in Naryn region gathered at the Solton-Sary gold mine demanding the company hire locals for work. Previously, Solton-Sary gold mine was shut down following a conflict between local villagers and the Chinese company in August 2019. [size=about 20]

On 23 December 2020, residents of Batken township in Batkern region protested at the Mayor's office against illegal transactions of drainage trays involving the chief of the water fund, whom residents accused of breaking the law, demanding their property back. Protesters insisted trays are owned by the public water trust fund. [size=no report]

On 22 December 2020, residents of Toktogul district protested at the local district court in Toktogul town against a cattle theft suspect's release to house arrest, which protesters disagreed and deamnded that the suspect be detained and prosecuted. [size=no report]

On 21 December 2020, human rights defenders and activists gathered at the Chingiz Aitmatov park in Bishkek city in protest against an alleged lack of action regarding child molestation incidents in the country and court judges complicity in such cases calling for the authorities to address public concerns. [size=no report]

On 20 December 2020, about 50 activists marched through Erkindik boulevard on to Ala-Too square in Bishkek city protesting against the referendum on Constitutional reform, demanding the government refrain from attempting to change the country's Constitution. [size=about 50]

On 18 December 2020, several protesters demonstrated on Ala-Too square in Bishkek city demanding the Kyrgyz government mine Jetim-Too mineral deposit for the benefit of Kyrgyz citizens and opposing the idea of the foreign companies managing the project. [size=several]

On 18 December 2020, about 10 activists marched through Erkindik boulevard from the railroad station to Ala-Too square in Bishkek city against worsening air pollution in the city, demanding the authorities and public pay attention to the deteriorating environmental situation in the country's capital. [size=about 10]

On 17 December 2020, about 15 land property owners from Kalys Ordo neighborhood protested outside the White House in Bishkek city, demanding the Kyrgyz authorities legalize their plots, which would allow them to build homes. [size=about 15]

On 17 December 2020, activists protested outside the Ministry of Economy in Bishkek city demanding the Kyrgyz government curb imports of poor quality petroleum from abroad, which is contributing to worsening air pollution in the city. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2020, residents of Gavrilovka village protested outside the Sokuluk district administration in the town of Sokuluk, demanding the authorities investigate illegal privatization of the local school building and transfer recovered property back to the community fund. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, defaulting mortgage holders protested outside the Kyrgyz government's administration in Bishkek city, demanding authorities assist them with loan payments. Protesters complained they were having difficulties due to loss of income. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, residents of Ak-Sai village in Batken district of Batken region blocked the Isfara-Vorukh road to protest increasing incidences of cattle theft, which protesters blamed the Tajik side for. They also demanded that authorities recover their stolen livestock from the Tajik territory. Tajik officials promised to resolve the issues at the meeting with the Kyrgyz counterparts. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, workers of the resort in Bosteri village of Issyk-Kul region protested on the hotel premises demanding wages for several months of work. Protesters called for authorities to intervene in the labor dispute. [size=no report]

On 15 December 2020, about 30 medics protested at the Ministry of Health in Bishkek city, demanding their wages after spending weeks in quarantined facilities for patients with coronavirus. Protesters complained they hadn't been paid for two months. [size=about 30]

On 15 December 2020, about 30 protesters demonstrated outside the Mayor's Office in Bishkek city, demanding the city administration annul the previously adopted city building plan, which protesters argued was illegal and lobbied by the construction companies. [size=about 30]

On 15 December 2020, victims of a housing scheme protested outside the Supreme Court in Bishkek city, demanding their court case be settled in their favor after five years of litigation in courts. Protesters complained they have yet to be compensated by a fraud organizer. [size=no report]

On 15 December 2020, residents of Ak-Zhar neighborhood in the outskirts of Bishkek city demonstrated on a nearby motor road, burning tires and demanding the local authorities provide a steady supply of electricity after frequent blackouts in the area. [size=no report]

Around 15 December 2020, residents of Deires-Sai village near the town of Kerben in Aksy district of Jalal-Abad region protested against demarcation works by the Uzbek border guards on the disputed borderland, demanding the Uzbek side stop its activity and move back to the mutually agreed-upon line. Protesters called for the Kyrgyz government to protect the country's land from illegal intrusion. [size=no report]

On 14 December 2020, teachers and medics that have been awarded subsidized apartments gathered outside their homes in Tunguch neighborhood of Bishkek city, calling for the interim government and parliament to assist them with mortgage payments, which were becoming unaffordable following coronavirus emergency. New homeowners complained they were forced to take up additional part-time jobs to pay for their properties. [size=no report]
KFTU: Kyrgyzstan Federation of Trade Unions; Labour Group (Kyrgyzstan)

On 14 December 2020, a group of unpaid sanatorium workers seized the building of Trade Union in Bishkek and tried to force the head of the union to sign a paper for reappointment of former chairman and allow employees to get paid for months of work. [size=no report]

On 14 December 2020, dozens of supporters of six detained police officers charged with torture and homicide demonstrated outside the office of State Security Service in Osh city demanding the release of all policemen from pre-trial detention. [size=dozens]

On 13 December 2020, activists protested on Erkindik boulevard in Bishkek city against the upcoming referendum on constitutional reform scheduled for 10 January 2021. Protesters demanded reform of the country's judiciary and stop attempts to curb free speech. [size=no report]

On 12 December 2020, citizens demonstrated on Ala-Too square in Bishkek city, calling for the Central Election Commission and presidential candidates to conduct a fair election, which is scheduled for 10 January 2021. Protesters argued Kyrgyzstan doesn't need more instability after the government's latest overthrow that took place in October 2020 following the controversial parliamentary election. [size=no report]
Women (Kyrgyzstan); BFI: Bishkek Feminist Initiatives Association

On 12 December 2020, women activists from Bishkek Feminist Initiatives Association and others organized a march on Erkindik boulevard in Bishkek city against gender inequality and domestic violence in the country, demanding changes in the Kyrgyz judiciary system toward gender-related cases. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2020, supporters of acting prime minister Sadyr Japarov protested in the town of Kyzyl-Kia in Batken region against his presidential election campaign manager, demanding Japarov's campaign headquarters remove him and replace him with their representative. Protesters accused the manager of having ties to the local corruption-prone establishment. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2020, about 60 veterans of the country's Armed Forces protested on main Ala-Too square in Bishkek city against proposed benefit cuts for veterans, demanding the authorities investigate the Ministry of Finance instead for alleged financial violations following state audit in 2011 and 2015. [size=about 60]

On 11 December 2020, about 200 workers of the Bozymchak mining project located in Jalal-Abad region protested outside the Kyrgyz government's administration in Bishkek city, demanding the country's interim authorities resolve a mining conflict between the local population and company. Protesters complained they have been out of work since 6 October due to local protests against the mine. [size=about 200]

On 11 December 2020, about 10 activists gathered outside the US embassy in Bishkek city holding banners supporting the US ambassador Donald Lu following his statement on 5 December regarding corruption in Kyrgyzstan. [size=about 10]

On 10 December 2020, supporters of former president Almazbek Atambayev demonstrated outside the Pervomayski district court in Bishkek city, demanding his release from pre-trial detention. [size=no report]

On 10 December 2020, activists protested at the Kyrgyz parliament building in Bishkek city against Constitutional reform, demanding the dismissal of the legislative assembly while questioning its legitimacy. [size=no report]

On 9 December 2020, about 50 supporters of the former State Security Service official Damir Musakeyev protested outside the Supreme Court in Bishkek city, demanding his release from prison. Protesters claimed Musakeyev was jailed on politically motivated charges. [size=about 50]

On 9 December 2020, about 10 activists protested outside the parliament in Bishkek city against the referendum on changes to the country's Constitution planned for 10 January 2021, demanding more public debates regarding the Constitutional reform, which is being pushed through without much discussion, protesters insisted. [size=about 10]
On 9 December 2020, about 10 female protesters demonstrated at the fertility clinic office in Bishkek city demanding their funds back after alleged unsuccessful fertility treatment. [size=about 10]

Around 8 December 2020, 70-80 residents of Issyk-Kul district gathered outside the house of a suspected male burglar in the village of Grigoryevka of Issyk-Kul region, who had a previous felony record, accusing him and his brothers of cattle stealing, and demanding suspect with his relatives compensate victims for damages and move out of the village. The demonstrators raided the suspect's cattle barn and confiscated more than 50 domesticated animals during a demonstration. [size=70-80]

On 8 December 2020, female patients of the fertility clinic protested outside its office in Bishkek city, demanding their funds back after women protesters claimed a clinic failed to deliver on its results for a successful pregnancy. [size=no report]
KFTU: Kyrgyzstan Federation of Trade Unions; Labour Group (Kyrgyzstan)

On 7 December 2020, about 50 members of Kyrgyzstan Federation of Trade Unions gathered at the Union headquarters in Bishkek city demanding wages for months of work, which protesters complained they couldn't receive on time due to the coronavirus crisis. [size=about 50]

On 6 December 2020, dozens of activists demonstrated on Ala-Too main square in Bishkek city against proposed amendments to the country's Constitution, claiming them as an attempt to establish authoritarian rule in the nation, demanding any changes to be discussed within the legal framework. [size=dozens]

On 3 December 2020, residents of Deires-Sai village near the town of Kyzyl-Jar in Aksy district of Jalal-Abad region gathered on the disputed border land in protest of demarcation activities by the Uzbek border guards demanding the Kyrgyz authorities address their concerns. Protesters complained the Uzbek border guards moved twenty meters deep into the Kyrgyz territory, which villagers refused to accept. [size=no report]

On 2 December 2020, activists and members of the Reforma political party gathered outside the Constitutional Chamber in Bishkek city to protest the national referendum on changes to the country's Constitution, demanding media and public access to the constitutional reform hearings. [size=no report]

On 30 November 2020, residents of Toleiken neighborhood in Osh city protested near disputed 3 hectares of agricultural land against an illegal and unfair land deal demanding the local authorities redistribute land plots among farmers and private investors. [size=no report]
On 30 November 2020, supporters of former president Almazbek Atambayev protested outside the Supreme Court in Bishkek city, demanding his release from pre-trial detention. [size=no report]

On 30 November 2020, residents of the bordering Deires-Sai village near the town of Kyzyl-Jar in Aksy district of Jalal-Abad region gathered on the disputed border land between Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan after demarcation activity by the Uzbek border guards, which villagers opposed to claiming the Uzbek troops intruded into the territory of Kyrgyzstan. Kyrgyz Border Service refuted protesters' claims indicating that Uzbek demarcation work was in line with the accord from 2017, which both countries agreed upon. [size=no report]

On 29 November 2020, hundreds of activists protested outside the main railroad station in Bishkek city against changes to the country's Constitution, which was initiated by the Interim government, demanding a national referendum on the Constitutional reform rejected. [size=hundreds]

On 27 November 2020, Osh bazaar meat shop owners protested outside the Prosecutor General's office in Bishkek city demanding the authorities intervene in a commercial dispute between the meat market owners, which harms retailers' operations, protesters complained. [size=no report]

On 27 November 2020, about 100 residents of the Bazar-Korgon district in Jalal-Abad region protested in the village of Gumkhana, demanding the authorities suspend the local Dashman state reserve's status and allow protesters' livestock to graze on its land. [size=about 100]

On 26 November 2020, several victims of female broker's fraudulent activity protested outside the Sverdlovsky district court in Bishkek city, demanding the law enforcement agencies investigate and arrest fraud suspect, and probe court judges that protesters accused of corruption after judges let fraud suspect walk free on multiple occasions, protesters claimed. [size=several]

On 26 November 2020, several workers of the state-owned company Kyrgyz railways protested at the Pishpek railroad station in Bishkek city against the company's director, demanding his dismissal from office and the authorities investigate him for alleged wrongdoing. [size=several]

On 25 November 2020, residents of the TETS-2 neighborhood protested near the Kyrgyz government's administration in Bishkek city, demanding the authorities legalize their land properties, which protesters complained is preventing infrastructure development in the area. [size=no report]

On 24 November 2020, residents of Ak-Ulak village near Min-Kush township in Naryn region protested against the local coal mine, demanding compensation for environmental damages and relocation to safety due to the negative impact of the coal mining operation. [size=no report]

On 24 November 2020, workers of the Severelectro power supply company protested outside the Kyrgyz government's administration in Bishkek city against the newly appointed director demanding the authorities bring back their former chief who was dismissed following the overthrow of the government in October 2020. [size=no report]

On 23 November 2020, residents of Pitomnik village near Kara-Suu township of Osh region protested against an unfair land deal with a local businessman in 1991, demanding 25 hectares of agricultural land leased to the villagers. [size=no report]

On 23 November 2020, residents of Mady village in Kara-Suu district of Osh region protested against the local donkey farm, demanding the authorities shut it down out of public health concerns in the area. [size=no report]
On 22 November 2020, about 500 protesters demonstrated on Ala-Too main square in Bishkek city against the constitutional reform, demanding its current version remain unchanged. [size=about 500]

On 21 November 2020, about 100 workers of the Tazalyk municipal company protested outside townhall in Karakol township of Issyk-Kul region demanding their former director reappointed to manage the municipal service or protesters will strike if their demands aren't met. [size=about 100]

On 21 November 2020, several protesters demonstrated outside the Ata-Meken political party's office in Bishkek city demanding its leader Omurbek Tekebayev apologize for his critical view of the constitutional reform. [size=several]

On 21 November 2020, about 100 supporters of the detained policemen protested outside the State Security Service office in Osh city demanding the release of all six police officers who were earlier arrested and charged with torture following a detainee's death while in custody. [size=about 100]

On 19 November 2020, workers of an internet and telecommunications service company protested outside the city court in Bishkek against the company's former owners and managers, accusing them of threatening presiding judges in the court case. [size=no report]

On 19 November 2020, residents of the multi-storey apartment building rioted against forced eviction, blocking access to bailiffs in Manas-Ata neighborhood of Osh city. A brief scuffle broke out between rioters and court representatives during a physical confrontation at the building's front entrance. [size=no report]

On 18 November 2020, residents of Balykchy city protested outside the municipal water department demanding its director resign after water fee increase and accusing the official of job position abuse. [size=no report]

On 17 November 2020, bus drivers of the Bishkek city municipal bus company protested on the premises against low pay and poor bus maintenance record, demanding the city administration replace their current director. Protesters accused city officials of embezzlement. [size=no report]

On 17 November 2020, residents of Alysh village in Kadamjai district of Batken region protested against the regional power supply project's planned installations through the village, demanding the Kyrgyz government build power supply lines away from town out of public health safety concerns and unresolved compensation dispute. [size=no report]
On 16 November 2020, Makarenko high-school teachers in Osh city protested on the premises demanding the authorities reappoint their former principal to lead the school. [size=no report]

On 16 November 2020, residents of Nookat district in Osh region protested in the town of Nookat against the newly-appointed head of the district administration demanding the authorities remove him from office. [size=no report]

On 16 November 2020, dozens of truck drivers protested outside the Talas regional state administration in Talas city against long delays for costly coronavirus test results, which protesters complained takes extra several days on the border with Kazakhstan. Drivers demanded the Kyrgyz authorities install a virus test facility on the border and provide testing free of charge for truck drivers. [size=dozens]

On 16 November 2020, about 15 supporters and family members of imprisoned former president Almazbek Atambayev protested outside the Supreme Court in Bishkek city, demanding his release from prison. [size=about 15]
